subject: RE: [OT] NoClassdefFoundError (was: Exception handling by junit)
msgSnippet: ... Well, it s actually not an exception, but an error... ;) ... It obviously means that not class definition for the specified classname could be found. How
messageBody:
junit@yahoogroups.com wrote:
> ClassDefNotFoundError is thrown when a class could not be loaded
> usually because its static initializer threw an exception.
>
> It's the most insidious of all Java exceptions

Well, it's actually not an exception, but an error... ;)

> because noone ever
> knows what it means (we get about 3 support calls about it a day)

It obviously means that not class definition for the specified classname
could be found. How could it get more specific?

> and
> it violates the convention that Errors represent a problem in the VM
> when its actually a user code problem.

Where do you get this convention from??? And what do you mean by "user code
problem"? In most instances I've seen it, the classpath simply was wrong.
Seems to be quite similar in nature to an OutOfMemoryError to me.

Anyway, an error is something a system typically can't recover from. I guess
that's true for a NoClassDefFoundError?

Confused, Ilja
